decision_conditions: The proposal by way of its architectural style, proportion and design details would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the street scene and the character and appearance of the Kingston Hill/Coombe Hill Strategic Area of Special Character. This would be contrary to Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), Policies CS8, and DM 10  of the Core Strategy (2012).

Insufficient information, by lack of a Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, has been submitted to determine if the proposed development would result in unacceptable impacts on the ecology and biodiversity on the site due to the close proximity of the development to a woodland and waterway, and that it fails to provide Biodiversity Net Gain, contrary to Paragraph 193 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2024, Policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
The proposed development would be deficient in cycle parking and would not comply with policy T5 of the London Plan and Policy DM 8 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.
Insufficient information has been submitted to demonstrate that the proposal will ensure the safety of future occupants, contrary to Policy D12 (Fire safety) of the London Plan 2021.
